___name.gltf_detailedDescription: The user-defined name of this object.  This is not necessarily unique, e.g., an accessor and a buffer could have the same name, or two accessors could even have the same name.
___name.description: The user-defined name of this object.

description: A camera's projection.  A node can reference a camera to apply a transform to place the camera in the scene.
title: Camera

$eref.description: A perspective camera containing properties to create a perspective projection matrix.
$eref.title: Camera Perspective

___znear.gltf_detailedDescription: The floating-point distance to the near clipping plane.
___znear.description: The floating-point distance to the near clipping plane.

___aspectRatio.gltf_detailedDescription: The floating-point aspect ratio of the field of view. When this is undefined, the aspect ratio of the canvas is used.
___aspectRatio.description: The floating-point aspect ratio of the field of view.

___zfar.gltf_detailedDescription: The floating-point distance to the far clipping plane. When defined, `zfar` must be greater than `znear`. If `zfar` is undefined, runtime must use infinite projection matrix.
___zfar.description: The floating-point distance to the far clipping plane.

___yfov.description: The floating-point vertical field of view in radians.

___perspective.description: A perspective camera containing properties to create a perspective projection matrix.

___type.gltf_detailedDescription: Specifies if the camera uses a perspective or orthographic projection.  Based on this, either the camera's `perspective` or `orthographic` property will be defined.
___type.description: Specifies if the camera uses a perspective or orthographic projection.

$eref.description: An orthographic camera containing properties to create an orthographic projection matrix.
$eref.title: Camera Orthographic

___xmag.description: The floating-point horizontal magnification of the view. Must not be zero.

___znear.description: The floating-point distance to the near clipping plane.

___ymag.description: The floating-point vertical magnification of the view. Must not be zero.

___zfar.description: The floating-point distance to the far clipping plane. `zfar` must be greater than `znear`.

___orthographic.description: An orthographic camera containing properties to create an orthographic projection matrix.
